info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 1:10AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Massac, southern Pope, northwestern Calloway, south central Crittenden, Livingston, Marshall, eastern Carlisle, southeastern Ballard, McCracken, northern Graves and northwestern Lyon Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 109 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Columbia to near Metropolis to Bardwell. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Metropolis, West Paducah and Barkley Regional Airport around 115 AM CDT. Paducah, Lone Oak and Brookport around 120 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Reidland, Mayfield, Ledbetter, Burna, Calvert City and Salem. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 36. Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 28 and 38. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 21 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southern Illinois...and western Kentucky.
